SourcedStatement: They planned to raise money from private donors for their mission. But within a few years, they realized that their computing needs required much more funding than they could raise from individuals.
Name: OpenAI
Justification: planned to raise money from private donors for their mission

SourcedStatement: After Mr. Musk left in 2018, they created a for-profit subsidiary that began raising billions of dollars from investors, including $1 billion from Microsoft.
Name: OpenAI
Justification: created a for-profit subsidiary that began raising billions of dollars from investors, including $1 billion from Microsoft

SourcedStatement: They said that the subsidiary would be controlled by the nonprofit board and that each director’s fiduciary duty would be to “humanity, not OpenAI investors,” the company said on its website.
Name: OpenAI
Justification: the company said on its website

SourcedStatement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
Name: Anthropic
Justification: an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said

SourcedStatement: Sam Altman called an OpenAI board member’s research paper a danger to the company weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive

SourcedStatement: At one point, Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company

SourcedStatement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: Board Member
Justification: thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board

SourcedStatement: The news that he was being pushed out came in a videoconference on Friday afternoon, when Mr. Sutskever, who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years, read him a statement.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: Board Member
Justification: who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years

SourcedStatement: Those tensions seemingly came to an end late Tuesday when Mr. Altman was reinstated as chief executive.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: reinstated as chief executive

SourcedStatement: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: Board Member
Justification: critical of Mr. Altman

SourcedStatement: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.
Name: Adam D’Angelo
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora

SourcedStatement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft, which asked him to lead an A.I. lab with Greg Brockman, who quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman.
Name: Greg Brockman
Title: President and Board Chairman
Justification: quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman

SourcedStatement: The board had told Mr. Brockman that he would no longer be OpenAI’s chairman but invited him to stay on at the company — though he was not invited to the meeting where the decision was made to push him off the board and Mr. Altman out of the company.
Name: Greg Brockman
Title: President and Board Chairman
Justification: told Mr. Brockman that he would no longer be OpenAI’s chairman but invited him to stay on at the company

Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: teamed with Elon Musk and others, including Mr. Sutskever, to create a nonprofit to build A.I. that was safe and beneficial to humanity

SourcedStatement: After Mr. Musk left in 2018, they created a for-profit subsidiary that began raising billions of dollars from investors, including $1 billion from Microsoft.

Justification: left in 2018

SourcedStatement: Among the tensions leading up to Mr. Altman’s ouster and quick return involved his conflict with Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: Board Member and Director of Strategy
Justification: a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: A few weeks before Mr. Altman’s firing, he met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: Board Member and Director of Strategy
Justification: met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center

SourcedStatement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: Board Member and Director of Strategy
Justification: defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.

SourcedStatement: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”
Name: Sam Altman
Title: Chief Executive
Justification: wrote in the email

SourcedStatement: The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn’t “consistently candid in his communications with the board.”
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: Board Member
Justification: read to Mr. Altman

SourcedStatement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.

Title: Spokeswoman

Justification: an Anthropic spokeswoman

SourcedStatement: Vacancies exacerbated the board’s issues. This year, it disagreed over how to replace three departing directors: Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member; Shivon Zilis, director of operations at Neuralink, a company started by Mr. Musk to implant computer chips in people’s brains; and Will Hurd, a former Republican congressman from Texas.
Name: Reid Hoffman
Title: LinkedIn Founder and Microsoft Board Member
Justification: the LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member

Title: Chief Strategy Officer

SourcedStatement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.

SourcedStatement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Justification: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations
